result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/17/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 3

Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Comply with all open bond conditions.

1:10 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Schulz in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Obstructing an Officer. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is eligible for public defender representation.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
